name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about California research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your California ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for California ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine priorities for California research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic California research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic California Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ AR—They Went West: California Research

  2. Get an overview of California research in this video.

    ☆ FS—California Overview—8:27

  3. Follow this research study for California ancestors, from 1850 to 1905.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step California Research, 1850-1905

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for California research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—California Resources
    ☆ AC—California State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the California Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—California Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

  6. Learn about colonial records in California.

    ☆ AC—Colonial Records of California

  7. Follow this case study for California research.

    ☆ LDS—Locating a San Francisco Man's Parents
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic

1. African American: Learn about African Americans in California in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for California

  2. Explore the African American Gateway for California.
  3. Visit the Nikkei Genealogical Society on Facebook.
  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in California in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of California

1. Explore California historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—California History

  2. Explore California history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of California

  3. Learn about California history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ California History

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about California archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about California archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about California archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: California Archives and Libraries
    ☆ California State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for California.
  3. Explore the California State Archives site.
  4. Explore the Online Archive of California.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for California genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on California research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  8. Explore the California History Resource Guide.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find California ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about California city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: California Directories

  2. Sites: Explore California city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore California city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore California ☆historical directories by county.

hidden.summary:
• Find online resources for vital records.
  • Learn the history of vital records in the state of California.
  • Learn about alternates for vital records in California.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for vital records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about California vital records in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: California Vital Records
    ☆ AC—Wiki: California Vital Records

  2. Explore links for vital records on the California Dept. of Public Health site.
  3. Search for online California ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  4. Explore California birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for California vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site and the Genealogy Branches site.
  6. Explore the Early California Population Project for vital records in the California Missions from 1769-1850.

name: Maps and Gazetteers
section_name: Learn about California maps and gazetteers.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for California research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or California County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for California.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the California Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your California research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the California Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the California Genealogy and Genealogists page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the California Genealogy page on Facebook.
  4. Visit California Genealogy - Just Ask!
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for California.
Regional/Local Groups:

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about California research.
  2. Explore the California research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about California research.
  4. Explore California research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in California in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: California Societies

  2. Explore the California Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Southern California Genealogical Society site.
  4. Explore the California Genealogical Society and Library site.
  5. Explore California genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  6. Get help at a family history center in California.
Regional/Local Societies
